document.heading: Anti-Drunk Driving Clarification Amendment Act of 2006

history.narrative: Law 16-195, the “Anti-Drunk Driving Clarification Amendment Act of 2006”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 16-463, which was referred to the Committee on Public Works and Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 11, 2006, and October 3, 2006, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 18, 2006, it was assigned Act No. 16-488 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 16-195 became effective on March 2, 2007.
